storyInfo: In the wastes of Columbia, Ash saves a group of people with entirely different backgrounds who all long for the same thing—a better life.

attributes.content: 'Lord, I hope you're enjoying Ursus.'
'I've arrived in Columbia. It's an interesting place - the only word I have to describe it.'
'I've been thinking about a question that we've all heard of or thought about. We might just trace the value and raison d'être of a good many things back to it.'
'Is the history that we're familiar with just a roll of the dice, or is there a degree of inevitability?'
'What would the world look like if we turned back the clock ten thousand years and allowed things to play out one more time?'
I think they've left.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: How can you tell?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Footsteps.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I always heard at least one set of footsteps at the mouth of the cave, but now it's all quiet. Something must have happened.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: How many days have we been in here?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I think this is day three.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: That puddle reflects a little bit of sunlight at dusk.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Maybe most of the group left. What are we waiting for?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I've had enough. I'm heading out now.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: We can cut the rope behind me. Let's get out of here.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: There's at least a dozen of them, all of them armed. We don't even know why they kidnapped us.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: At least they didn't kill us on the spot. This is our chance.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Maybe we should wait. If we get on the wrong side of them...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: You can stay here and wait for death if you want.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Me, I'm going. Columbia is so close. If I'm gonna die, I would rather not die here.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Need a hand?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: 'It's been some time since we arrived in this strange world. I can't say I'm used to life here yet, and I'm sure the same is true for you.'
'But if you ignore the unfamiliar creatures for a minute, you will find this world more familiar than you might think.'
'It may sound strange, but this is where my mind is.'
'We should do what we can to understand it.'
From the tracks here, it looks like the main group left three days ago. Unfortunately, my car broke down the day before I ran into you.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: It doesn't look like we'll be able to catch them.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Oh no! I knew they wouldn't wait for us.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Who would stop to wait when the wealth of Columbia awaits?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: But we paid them. They didn't even try to find us...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: The barrens are a dangerous place. They didn't want to linger, even for a day...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Life is about looking out for number one. We just have to live with it. Never, I say, never count on someone else!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I agree, and complaining won't do any good. We're on our own here.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: According to the map, the closest village is about a hundred clicks to the south. We'll need to resupply there.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: South? But we're going west!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: An ancient eastern philosopher once said: need to save food for three months for a thousand-mile journey.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Food? Not money?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Never mind... anyway, we'll need to prepare, if we want to make it where we're going.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: There's no time to complain. Put yourselves together; we're leaving.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Alright, one more time.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Your name is Erwin. You're a Caprinae, and you hail from Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: You're ruled by the Twin Empresses, and you have a lot of people who are skilled in the... Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Don't forget our proud musical tradition.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Your name's Nikola. You're from Ursus, and your race is Ursus too.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Yes. The name Ursus is feared by many nations, and by many of its own people.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Your name is Alicja. You're from Kazimierz, home to the famous knight sports.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: That's right!
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: I have some questions about these knight sports.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: These are corporate-sponsored fights to the death by hired warriors, forming an important part of the Kazimierzian economy.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: The 'knights' competing in these competitions are considered stars, even heroes, and human life is a commodity.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: That's what people who have been to the big cities say.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Strange, but not incomprehensible.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: May I ask a frank question? You're clearly a skilled warrior, seeing how you saved us from those bandits.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: But your knowledge about our lands seems to be rather lacking.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Where exactly are you from?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Pardon me. I come from a place that is, shall I say, pretty far away.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: That doesn't really matter. She saved our lives; we should trust her.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: We're in this together, at least for now, since we're going to the same place.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: You said you were traveling as a group, heading for Columbia?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Victoria, Gaul... now Columbia.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Nikola, Erwin and I set out from a village in western Kazimierz, as part of a pioneer group.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: You've heard of the Great Expansion, haven't you?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Great Expansion... yes, I've heard the word.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Of course you have! Even someone who hasn't heard of the Kazimierz Major must have heard of the Great Expansion! Who could hear the name and not feel their heart race?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Just imagine! Massive nomadic cities roaming the wilds, delivering supplies to farms and mines, showering you with money in exchange for goods!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Yeah! I heard that Columbia has endless expanses of land waiting to be cultivated. No one will take your lands from you, and everything you grow belongs to you.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: You can have an entire farm, if you're willing to work hard!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Wait a second, brother. Where's your ambition?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: A farm? Mines are where the real money is!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Excuse me. By 'mines', do you mean Originium mines?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Of course! What else?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: But aren't they a source of infection?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: And Catastrophes - nomadic cities can avoid Catastrophes, but not mines and farms. Won't that threaten your dreams?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Sounds like Columbia is telling you there's a chance to get rich here.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: People from around the world risk their lives to help Columbia expand its borders, without the government putting any skin in the game.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: You say such strange things...
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Of course mining is dangerous - even a burdenbeast knows that. So what? Look at this thing on my neck. What do I care about danger?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I meant no offense. I'm not making any accusations. I'm in no position to do that.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Catastrophes are pretty low on the list of things that can lose you your farm.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: You never know when a Catastrophe might take your farm in the barrenlands, but you know for sure that your lord will take your farm in Ursus.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: You're right - we all have to try to survive.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: And I hear you can have a good life in Columbia as long as you have money, whether you're Infected or normal, Caprinae or Sarkaz. Now THAT's what I call fair.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I never thought you Leithanians were concerned about these things.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: The Infected are pests anywhere, it's just that Leithanien isn't so diligent about pest control.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: But none of this matters once we arrive in Columbia.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: You're right. Everything will be fine once we get to Columbia.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Have any of you ever been to Columbia?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Never.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Don't worry, we've all heard the stories.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I saw a movie about a poor Sargon kid who made his fortune in Columbia!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: The Columbians have no taste in music, but that movie thing is pretty interesting.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Yeah, interesting. I think I've seen that movie before.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: My father went to Columbia...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: I got a letter from him a month ago, saying he's settled down there, and inviting me to join him.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Your father's in Columbia? You never told us!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I-I still can't believe it... he left home so many years ago. Who knows how long it took for the letter to reach me from Columbia...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Ah, now I get it!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Someone knew your dad got rich in Columbia and hired people to kidnap you for ransom! Everything makes sense now!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Ah, so we two poor sods got dragged into the mess of a rich man's daughter?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Think on the bright side, brother! This proves that you really can strike it rich in Columbia!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Y-You're right!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Are you sure that's what happened?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Of course it is! What else could it be!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Looks like getting kidnapped wasn't such a bad thing!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Sister, we've been through hell together. You should tell us what your dad does once you find him!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: That's right! Let's share the wealth!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: A-Alright.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: What about you? Why are you going to Columbia?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Same as you.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Looking for a job.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Excuse me, may I look at the map?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: This is... yes! It must be! This hill! Right here!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: See that? That's City No.9! Have you ever seen a nomadic city that big?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: It'll be the center of a new Columbia-Kazimierz highway that will open up trade between the two countries - even the intercity net!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Columbian films will enter the Kazimierzian market, and the Major finals in The Grand Knight Territory will be broadcast in real-time in Columbia!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: The stories are true!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: It's so big...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: I've never seen anything that big in my life.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: It's a monumental landmark alright.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I'll work there someday. I'll make my own fortune. No one can stop me—
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: 'Massive cities sail the wasteland under a setting sun, a scene surreal and awe-inspiring in equal measure.'
'But we all know that spectacular wonders are often built from mundane bricks, even downright ugly ones.'
'The glamorous surface always hides the same lies.'
'The eyes of everyone here are full of dreams, a kind of pure, naive passion that I've only seen in the eyes of the most loyal warriors and most innocent children.'
'But I don't know what awaits them ahead.'
'Or perhaps we all know how the story ends, because history has shown it too many times.'
Recoil will throw your aim off, if you're tense.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Relax. The key is in the rhythm of your breathing.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Very good. Line up your sights with the target, then squeeze the trigger.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Not bad, for a first try.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Less meat for dinner, though.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Does everyone learn to use this, where you come from?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: No... we take up arms so others can lay them down.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I hope the day will never come when you have to take up arms. But if it comes, you'll be glad you learned this.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Crossbows might be more useful for you guys. I have a friend who would've been a good teacher, if she was here.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I know how to use a bow! I've even hunted with it!
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: I fantasized about becoming as skilled as the knights... but I gave up practicing after dad gave me a scolding.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Interesting. I had a similar experience myself, though I wasn't so obedient.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Choose your own way for yourself, when you start your new life.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: We've got firewood. We can make dinner now.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager (no portrait)

attributes.content: Let's go. You must be hungry.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Aren't you hungry?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: These sandworm cans are the only food we have left. It's a little salty, but food is food.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I kind of like it. If only we had some rye bread.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: No argument there... I'll have some. Food in this place is safe to eat, as far as I can tell.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: It's... not too bad.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Mm... I feel so warm.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Hot food always makes you feel that things aren't so bad, right? Like there's always a way.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Of course. Columbia is a stone's throw away. Soon we'll be starting new lives.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Hear, hear.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Let's not forget this!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Booze? Where did you find it?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: I grabbed a couple of things when we left that cave. Payback for getting us separated from the caravan.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Can't read the label though. Looks like it's in Columbian...
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Nice! A drink is exactly what we need right now.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Too bad I sold my cello in Leithanien, or I would play something for us.
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Didn't realize you had that up your sleeves.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: What could be more shameful than a Leithanian who doesn't play an instrument?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Here's to music! And to the new cello that you'll buy once you've made your fortune in Columbia.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: A drink, sister?
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: S-Sorry, I'm not much of a drinker.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Too bad. Not many chances to drink your fill like this back home.
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: Too bad, too bad. Well, brother, prost!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: To a new life!
attributes.name: Ursus Villager

attributes.content: To Columbia!
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Look at me, I almost forgot about the fraulein. Care to join us?
attributes.name: Leithanian Worker

attributes.content: Sorry, I'll pass.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I'd love to join, but I need to stay alert tonight.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: A short distance from the camp.
Line of sight isn't great. We should have made our move earlier.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Don't worry, they won't get out of the forest.
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Careful. They might still be with the one who hit our camp.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: We're ready this time. We'll make them pay.
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Stay here while I scout ahead. If I get a shot...
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Back so soon?
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: He's not coming back.
Experienced, but not professional enough.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Put down your weapon.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: It was you—
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Sure was.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Please answer the rest of my questions just as honestly.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Who sent you?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Eat sh—
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: I'm not in a great mood today. If this is how you want to continue the conversation, I'm happy to oblige.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Why did you kidnap them?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Money.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Farms and mines always need new labor. There's always business to be done with pioneer groups traveling across the wasteland.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Why those three?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Those three? What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: You killed our guys. We came after you!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: What are you waiting for?
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: You won. The remaining supplies and ammo are yours.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Do it!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: 'I didn't write this to accuse. I'm in no position to do that.'
'As they say, you should not criticize someone until you have walked a mile in their shoes.'
'This is an interesting world, one that is different from ours. It is like a mirror, and we must reflect upon what it is reflecting.'
'I have learned a lot in this world.'
Where did you go?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: I took care of a little problem.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I heard strange sounds...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: It's all fine now.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Get some sleep. You'll need it for the journey ahead.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: But I can't sleep...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Well then, come sit with me and we can have a little chat.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I'm not sure why, but I feel afraid.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: It's normal to fear the unknown. It's called caution, and it's a good thing to have.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: What are you worried about, Alicja?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I'm not sure... the others are so excited for Columbia, and they can't wait to get there.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: But the more eager they are, the more concerned I get. Can it really be as good as the stories say? What kind of place is Columbia, actually?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: That's a good question, but the wrong person to ask.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I come from a place far away, you know that. I'm way less familiar with this land than you. We're going to learn about it together.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Let's see it with our own eyes. We don't have to blindly believe the words of others, or the experiences of the past. We'll observe and think.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: But first, we'll need to get there. We need to keep walking.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Keep walking...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Girl

attributes.content: Keep walking.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: If that's not enough to set your mind at ease, let me tell you a story.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: A story of a place that's very much like Columbia...
attributes.name: Ash
